alert.note: Alert for Kittson (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 16 at 11:30AM CDT until May 23 at 9:00AM CDT by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Minnesota... Wild Rice River (MN) at Hendrum affecting Norman County. Snake River below Warren affecting Marshall County. Two Rivers River near Hallock affecting Kittson County. ...The Flood Warning is cancelled for the following rivers in Minnesota... Red Lake River at Crookston affecting Polk County. Roseau River at Roseau affecting Roseau County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Minnesota... Snake River AT Alvarado affecting Marshall County. Buffalo River near Dilworth affecting Clay County. .Water levels are slowly receding within the Red River tributaries of Minnesota. A system is expected to move into North Dakota between late Wed and Fri. This increases the chance of widespread precipitation, possibly impacting river levels. However,to what degree this potential precipitation may impact river levels is uncertain at this time. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Two Rivers River near Hallock. * WHEN...Until late Monday morning. * IMPACTS...At 807.0 feet, Storm sewer valves at 175 bridge, 4th St S, and the cemetery are closed and portable pumps are set up. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 AM CDT Monday the stage was 806.8 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:00 AM CDT Monday was 806.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 807.0 feet tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 802.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Safety message - Turn around, don`t drown. Don`t travel through flooded areas. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
